description: Describes a budget action history detail.

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The account ID of the user. It's a 12-digit number.

parameters.name: BudgetName
parameters.description: A string that represents the budget name. The ':' and '" characters, and the '/action/' substring, aren't allowed.

parameters.name: ActionId
parameters.description: A system-generated universally unique identifier (UUID) for the action.

parameters.name: TimePeriod
parameters.description: The period of time that's covered by a budget. The period has a start date and an end date. The start date must come before the end date. There are no restrictions on the end date. Start (datetime) --- The start date for a budget. If you created your budget and didn't specify a start date, Amazon Web Services defaults to the start of your chosen time period (DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, or ANNUALLY). For example, if you created your budget on January 24, 2018, chose DAILY, and didn't set a start date, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/24/18 00:00 UTC. If you chose MONTHLY, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/01/18 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. You can change your start date with the UpdateBudget operation. End (datetime) --- The end date for a budget. If you didn't specify an end date, Amazon Web Services set your end date to 06/15/87 00:00 UTC. After the end date, Amazon Web Services deletes the budget and all the associated notifications and subscribers. You can change your end date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_params.name: Start
nested_params.description: The start date for a budget. If you created your budget and didn't specify a start date, Amazon Web Services defaults to the start of your chosen time period (DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, or ANNUALLY). For example, if you created your budget on January 24, 2018, chose DAILY, and didn't set a start date, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/24/18 00:00 UTC. If you chose MONTHLY, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/01/18 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. You can change your start date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_params.name: End
nested_params.description: The end date for a budget. If you didn't specify an end date, Amazon Web Services set your end date to 06/15/87 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. After the end date, Amazon Web Services deletes the budget and all the associated notifications and subscribers. You can change your end date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_items.name: ActionHistories
nested_items.description: The historical record of the budget action resource.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: A generic time stamp. In Java, it's transformed to a Date object.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of action at the time of the event.

nested_items.name: EventType
nested_items.description: This distinguishes between whether the events are triggered by the user or are generated by the system.

nested_items.name: ActionHistoryDetails
nested_items.description: The description of the details for the event.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A generic string.

nested_items.name: ActionId
nested_items.description: A system-generated universally unique identifier (UUID) for the action.

nested_items.name: BudgetName
nested_items.description: A string that represents the budget name. The ':' and '" characters, and the '/action/' substring, aren't allowed.

nested_items.name: NotificationType
nested_items.description: The type of a notification. It must be ACTUAL or FORECASTED.

nested_items.name: ActionType
nested_items.description: The type of action. This defines the type of tasks that can be carried out by this action. This field also determines the format for definition.

nested_items.name: ActionThreshold
nested_items.description: The trigger threshold of the action.

nested_items.name: ActionThresholdValue
nested_items.description: The threshold of a notification.

nested_items.name: ActionThresholdType
nested_items.description: The type of threshold for a notification.

nested_items.name: Definition
nested_items.description: Where you specify all of the type-specific parameters.

nested_items.name: IamActionDefinition
nested_items.description: The Identity and Access Management (IAM) action definition details.

nested_items.name: PolicyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy to be attached.

nested_items.name: Roles
nested_items.description: A list of roles to be attached. There must be at least one role.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Groups
nested_items.description: A list of groups to be attached. There must be at least one group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Users
nested_items.description: A list of users to be attached. There must be at least one user.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ScpActionDefinition
nested_items.description: The service control policies (SCPs) action definition details.

nested_items.name: PolicyId
nested_items.description: The policy ID attached.

nested_items.name: TargetIds
nested_items.description: A list of target IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SsmActionDefinition
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) action definition details.

nested_items.name: ActionSubType
nested_items.description: The action subType.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Region to run the SSM document.

nested_items.name: InstanceIds
nested_items.description: The EC2 and RDS instance IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExecutionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The role passed for action execution and reversion. Roles and actions must be in the same account.

nested_items.name: ApprovalModel
nested_items.description: This specifies if the action needs manual or automatic approval.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the action.

nested_items.name: Subscribers
nested_items.description: A list of subscribers.
A subscriptionType of EMAIL.
An address of example@example.com.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A generic string.
